meanings.definition: To mend or repair with a patch.
meanings.sent1: She patched her torn dress with a colorful piece of fabric.
meanings.sent2: He patched the leaky roof before the rain started.
meanings.sent3: The tailor patched up the ripped pants in no time.
meanings.sent4: They patched things up after their argument, restoring peace.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic patched the tire quickly, getting the car back on the road.

meanings.sent1: The patched quilt was a beautiful mix of colors and patterns.
meanings.sent2: Her patched jeans were a trendy fashion statement.
meanings.sent3: The patched blanket kept her warm on chilly nights.
meanings.sent4: The patched road was bumpy but full of character.
meanings.sent5: The patched jacket had a unique style that stood out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: A small piece of material used to mend a hole or tear.
meanings.sent1: She sewed a patch onto the jeans to cover the hole.
meanings.sent2: He carried a patch in his bag for any unexpected tears.
meanings.sent3: The colorful patch added a fun touch to the plain shirt.
meanings.sent4: The patch served as a quick fix for the torn backpack strap.
meanings.sent5: The scout earned a badge for sewing on a patch during camp.
